H0.text: Evolution is the process that occurs in a growing leaf cell, which is one type of tree cell.

H1.text: Adaptation is the process that occurs in a growing leaf cell, which is a type of tree cell.

H2.text: Sugar production is the process that occurs in a growing leaf cell, which is a type of tree cell.

H3.text: Sexual reproduction is the process that occurs in a growing leaf cell, which is a type of tree cell.

A4.text: All chloroplasts in a plant are descended from undifferentiated proplastids found in the zygote, or fertilized egg.

A5.text: In low-light conditions, they will spread out in a sheetâ€”maximizing the surface area to absorb light.
